title: Old MF need a buff now new MF needs a buff when will Rito buff MF????
body: Old Miss Fortune needed a buff, now new Miss Fortune needs a buff when will Rito buff Miss Fortune????.

replies.body: She needs an identity, she has no niche. A few years back Miss Fortune would be used in wombo combo comps but after scaling changed and ultimate nerfs that is no longer the case. Sure she is a lane bully but is that really a niche. When I think of Miss Fortune I think of her passive "strut". With the recent change to Miss Fortune's W "impure shots" a case can be made that Riot sees it that way too. So why not build on her passive and make it more impactful. For years players have expressed the desire for ranged minion aggro to not deactivate strut yet such a change has never been made. I love Miss Fortune, I want to see her played in competitive play, but in order for that to happen she needs more help, why not try expanding on her passive a bit more.

This. SOOOOO much of this. MF is a strong ADC, she just doesn't do anything specific. Her early game damage is good and her mid game damage is better than the majority of ADC's he just doesn't have a specific thing that makes her stand out from other ADC's, which is why many people think she's weak. A buff to strut would be great. She's a pirate hunter for gods sake, she should be chasing people down and getting the heck out once she's down. Making strut a little more durable would go a LONG way. But numbers wise, she's a good ADC which is probably why people Riot is scared of buffing her.

The problem with Q is it is worthless late game. I've been playing somce S2 and used to main MF. Q late game is almost always out damaged by just AA's, and the reason is because while the reset on Q is amazing early game, it does not scale with attack speed. Essentially, by the time you fire that Q, you could have just auto'd twice, with the chance to crit on those.

In lane phase double up is awesome. I dislike that they took out how it used to prioritize champions, but the trade off is the execute. I think that is cool because it rewards you for last hitting and having skillful positioning. The problem is if you go up against anyone who knows what they are doing, it is incredibly difficult to land the Q, especially since the radius was also lowered to 60.

I'd love if MF had some kind of niche late game. In order to really make her useful, you need a team comp built around using her ult. And even if you have that, you are still vulnerable for the while duration, and the ranp up time to actually be doing any real damage is quite awhile. And I am totally okay with her being vulnerable!  I think that is actually a good trade off for having such a cool aoe ult! The problem is the damage is just so lack luster, I often wonder if I should have just auto'd instead.

Her ult scales with AP, and kind of AD thanks to impure shots. The impure shots scaling is absurdly low though, same goes for AP. It had the cool noche of applying black cleaver stacks, but then you are forced to buy a black cleaver which is lack luster, especially since a good portion of your damage is magic.

If you want AOE on the team, Graves burst combo is safer and more reliable, and jinx is simply always a good pick with AOE crit rockets.

did you even read my post? I mentioned the AA reset. Double Up's Burst comes on the second hit, given that the skill doesn't crit by itself, In late game, your AAs have the chance of dealing more damage because of critical chance and IE, this is a FACT. You can and will see big numbers in the bounce if you kill the first target  sure, but there's no "burst" in late game when your AA can outdamage your first double up hit. Don't say you just have to use it for the bounce because it's not realistic. Chances are you're going to duel someone smart enough not to be around minions or dying targets, meaning you can't possibly take into consideration that Double up WILL get this bonus damage all the time in the late game.

While being a "buff", it's situational. If the skill itself was changed to enable criticals in it's formula instead of this situational damage by execute you could factor it in late game damage. It's a beauty to use in lane when you master it but other than that it's just an AA reset outside Lane.
Technically the 50% damage isn't a crit either, so if you could land those together... oh boy.

Nono, Maybe I'm not explaining myself clearly. The 150% damage shows like a critical if you kill the first target. It's just a band-aid as of why the skill doesn't crit. A much simpler solution would have been not to add that 150% damage execute component but just allow the skill itself to crit. Like....if the first hit criticals, the second will critical as well, get my drift?

Sure she is a lane bully but is that really a niche.** When I think of Miss Fortune I think of her passive "strut"**. With the recent change to Miss Fortune's W "impure shots" a case can be made that Riot sees it that way too. **So why not build on her passive and make it more impactful.** For years players have expressed the desire for ranged minion aggro to not deactivate strut yet such a change has never been made. I love Miss Fortune, I want to see her played in competitive play, but in order for that to happen she needs more help, why not try expanding on her passive a bit more.

Strut isn't her Identity, Impure shots and her team-fighting ability with also dealing magic damage via autoattacks is her Identity. 

Her passive is the number one reason why MF players have been voicing concern over the years and is her Achilles heel in part also because it has no cohesion to how she is played.

Now I do agree that her passive can be built to be made more impactful to her kit, but for that to happen. Strut has to go.

One part of the MF players want the passive to be given the Garen treatment (certain lvl it then becomes immune to minions).

Another part wants a more impactful change, be it removal of passive or give her dashes blah blah.

This is just like the Cassiopeia discussions, which I was a part of and just sours my mouth to think about how it divided everyone when the way people think of how it should have been done and those of us that were left behind.

Enough that derail though.

tl;dr:

Strut isn't her Identity. Impure shots is her identity.

Impure shots is just a steroid, how can it be her identity?  Sure, it's important to *have* a steroid, but unless it's something really mechanically unusual like Draven axes, it can't really be an identity.

IMO Bullet Time is her real signature move; it needs to be buffed to Vel'koz levels or beyond, to make a really big reward for players and teams who succeed in setting it up.  It needs to do *noticeably* more damage than Ez/Draven/Jinx to make up for the short range and long channel.  (The fact that it goes through multiple targets instead of being blocked already distinguishes it from Lucian and potentially balances out his ability to move.)

Impure shots is a big part of her identity though, or at least Riot wants it to be. It's not just a steroid, it's a HUGE part of her damage, to access her full damage potential you need to stack impure shots, Q applies impure shots, ulti applies impure shots and it's damage increases depending on how many impure shot stacks are in the targets hit.  In a perfect world where the entire enemy team has 8 impure shot stacks and sits like a duck as MF Ults, they get 1000 physical damage+384% of her AD as magic damage.

However, the more I think about it, this whole new Impure shots mechanic became detrimental to her, here's why:

As the game progresses, R unlocks more impure shot stacks. On paper, this seems awesome because you keep gaining damage, however.....you have MORE conditions to get this boost. It's like oh here's a long ladder for you to access your true damage potential that doesn't benefit from you getting armor penetration or lifesteal. If you look at Sivir for example, On the Hunt's passive clearly aids Ricochet, it provides Sivir with MORE AS while ricochet is active so she can get off those enhanced auto attacks easier in a fight or a duel. With MF it's a counterproductive mechanich. This can be fixed in many ways and I don't know if Riot has tried them or not, but we get no feedback either

Impure shots could be reworked in many ways to keep it in her gameplay. Off the top of my head:
Swap Strut and Impure shots, Impure shots becomes her passive, her AAs deals extra bonus magic damage with a fixed AD ratio that scales up at lvl 11 and 16, stacking up to 5 per target the entire game. She Laughs when she reaches 5 stacks on a target for clarity. Strut's aditional MS keeps being a passive and the active is the AS steroid Strut can't be lowered below 35 for the 6 seconds.

Keep Impure shots in W, R doesn't add more stacks, it just increases the AD ratio passively to 7%/8.5%/10% to reach a similar damage cap (it's currently 36% max, 42% max, 48% max). This makes her damage potential crystal clear and her ult's damage more reliable if she gets it off

Rework Make it rain to have it take into account applying Impure shots.

You're right though, when Vel'koz came out my immediate thought was that MF should be able to redirect the cone just like he does lol

I think what should be done is her playstyle and kit should reflect more to what she is doing while addressing the issues in the past.

An example:

{{champion:21}}  **Miss Fortune**

- Passive removed
- Movespeed increased to 335 (up from 325 live servers)
- New passive added: **Shock & Awe**

**Passive - Shock & Awe:**
Shock: For every 5% of bonus attack speed you gain from outside this passive and outside Impure shots' active, you gain 0.5 points of flat Magic penetration. 
Awe: For every 1 point of flat Magic penetration you gain outside this passive, you gain 1.25% of bonus attack speed.


**Double-Up [Q]:**

- Changed to a skill shot
- Bounce mechanic removed
- Upon colliding with a target after it is fired, the projectile splinters into a spray of shrapnel onto the target and behind it in a cone dealing damage (Think of Lissandra Q and Graves Ult blended together on a smaller scale)
- Graphic animation could be a (recolored/altered) version of the new Bullet Time textures for the explosion spray

**Impure Shots [W]:**

- Strut steroid mechanic removed


**Make it Rain [E]:**

- Mana cost reduction per level
OR
- Flat mana cost reduction
OR
- Applies Impure Shots' stacks


**Bullet Time [R]:**

- Autoattacking while channeling no longer cancels the channel of Bullet Time (Press [R] again to stop or wait until channel is finished)


So a Synapses:

MF is nimble _enough_ that she is along side the speeds of Sivir {{champion:15}} , Quinn {{champion:133}} , Jayce {{champion:126}} , Lucian {{champion:236}} since strut is removed.

New passive doesn't stack upon itself, but is unique enough that it scales upon **what her kit currently emphasizes** on what she does. Not major, just icing on the top.

Double-Up [Q] isn't just an autoattack reset and confined to laning phase bouncing mechanics, but it now has more opportunity uses after the laning moving into mid/late game.

Quality of life changes to Make it Rain [E] and Bullet Time [R].

I personally think would be solid in her dealing small to larger AoE scale fighting and consistent DPS in Ad/Magic.
